EstimateInstrumentMargin(IBrokerageProvider, Instrument, SignedQuantity, double)

Calculates approximately the margin needed to enter new position for specified instrument Does not perform any queries to broker server and thus provides a high speed of calculations Also it does not take into account current open positions. Pay attention that client-side calculations may differ from real margin calculations provided by broker To get more precise margin calculation SimulateTrade(TradeSimulationParameters)

public static double EstimateInstrumentMargin(this IBrokerageProvider brokerageProvider, Instrument instrument, SignedQuantity signedQuantity, double price)

Parameters

brokerageProvider IBrokerageProvider
instrument Instrument
signedQuantity SignedQuantity

Negative values mean sell, positive - buy

price double

Returns

double

GetAlignedQuantity(IBrokerageProvider, InstrumentKey, Quantity)

Gets aligned quantity quantity to GetInstrumentQuantityStep(InstrumentKey). For example, the quantity step is 10, and the specified quantity is 15, then the result will be aligned to the nearest value 10 The method returns the same quantity if it is already aligned to the step or if the step is undefined (NaN or Zero)

public static Quantity GetAlignedQuantity(this IBrokerageProvider provider, InstrumentKey instrumentKey, Quantity quantity)

Parameters

provider IBrokerageProvider
instrumentKey InstrumentKey
quantity Quantity

Aligned quantity quantity

Returns

Quantity

GetInstrumentLeverage(IBrokerageProvider, Instrument, SignedQuantity)

Some brokers may variate a leverage depending on instrument, trade direction or demanded quantity By default, if there are no special rules, Leverage is returned

public static double GetInstrumentLeverage(this IBrokerageProvider brokerageProvider, Instrument instrument, SignedQuantity signedQuantity)

GetInstrumentMinTradeDistance(IBrokerageProvider, Instrument, OrderType)

Parameters

Returns

double

GetInstrumentMinTradeDistancePoints(IBrokerageProvider, Instrument, OrderType)

Returns a minimal distance in points from the current price to set stop or limit order For example, with min stop size =0, you can set Buy Stop order at Ask price and Sell Stop order at Bid price But usually, providers do not allow to set orders right on the current price

public static long GetInstrumentMinTradeDistancePoints(this IBrokerageProvider brokerageProvider, Instrument instrument, OrderType orderType)

Parameters

brokerageProvider IBrokerageProvider
instrument Instrument
orderType OrderType

Type of order to use. Pay attention that sending Market does not make sense. Market order always has distance =0

Returns

long

Remarks

To convert points to price use PointSize

GetInstrumentPointValue(IBrokerageProvider, Instrument, CalculatePointValueCurrency)

Returns the point cost of specified instrument denominated in

  • instrument base currency (Instrument), Currency
  • account currency (Account), Currency If it is impossible to calculate point value (for example, currency rates are not received yet), returns NaN GetInstrumentPointValue(InstrumentKey, string)
public static double GetInstrumentPointValue(this IBrokerageProvider brokerageProvider, Instrument instrument, CalculatePointValueCurrency currency)

currency CalculatePointValueCurrency

double

GetNettingPosition(IBrokerageProvider, Instrument)

Returns the summarized position for specified instrument If the account trading mode is netting, then only one position for instrument is possible and in this case summarized position is equal to this sole position But for hedging accounts, there may be many positions for instrument

public static AggregatedPosition GetNettingPosition(this IBrokerageProvider brokerageProvider, Instrument instrument)

Parameters

brokerageProvider IBrokerageProvider
instrument Instrument

Returns

AggregatedPosition

GetNettingPositionQuantity(IBrokerageProvider, Instrument)

Returns the summarized position quantity for specified instrument, negative result means short position (Sell), 0 means flat position (Flat) and positive value means long position (Buy) If the account trading mode is netting, then only one position for instrument is possible and in this case summarized position is equal to this sole position But for hedging accounts, there may be many positions for instrument GetNettingPosition(IBrokerageProvider, Instrument) for getting the detailed information about summarized position

public static SignedQuantity GetNettingPositionQuantity(this IBrokerageProvider brokerageProvider, Instrument instrument)

Parameters

brokerageProvider IBrokerageProvider
instrument Instrument

Returns

SignedQuantity

Negative value for short result position, positive value for long result position and zero for flat position

Remarks

This method is a bit faster than GetNettingPosition(IBrokerageProvider, Instrument) because it calculates only result quantity, without price
